intro: Praravinia sarawacensis, commonly known as the Sarawakian praravinia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
